node.title: Twitter's new Indian-American CEO highlights corporate Australia's lack of cultural diversity
node.alt: Bio shoot supplied of Parag Agrawal smiling, wearing a black t-shirt
node.description: American technology giants including Twitter, Google, Microsoft and IBM are among American companies promoting people of Indian origin to CEO. But in Australia, it is rare for top publicly listed company chiefs to come from culturally diverse backgrounds, Nassim Khadem writes.Â
node.content:
["Tesla boss\u00a0Elon Musk summed it up nicely when he tweeted in reaction to the latest Indian-American,\u00a0Parag Agrawal,\u00a0being appointed chief executive of a technology giant \u2014\u00a0this time at\u00a0Twitter.\u00a0", "Mr Agrawal, who joined Twitter in 2011 and rose through the ranks to become the firm's chief technology officer, was on Tuesday announced as CEO after Jack Dorsey announced he was stepping down from the role.", "Mr Musk was responding to Patrick Collison, the CEO of financial services and software company Stripe, who was among many on Twitter pointing out that Indian-born\u00a0Agrawal\u00a0is part of a growing list of CEOs of Indian origin\u00a0heading tech giants with billion-dollar-plus market caps including (but not limited to) Google, Microsoft, Adobe, IBM and Palo Alto Networks.", "Replying to this tweet, the billionaire and SpaceX founder said, \"USA benefits greatly from Indian talent!\".", "According to Bloomberg, at 37 years of age, Mr Agrawal is the youngest person to run a company in the S&P 500.\u00a0", "Mr Agrawal\u00a0has\u00a0been involved in the company's crypto and blockchain teams.", "Commentators say the appointment as top boss\u00a0signals that the company will continue to focus on blockchain and decentralised technologies.\u00a0", "
Dorsey makes way for Agrawal
", "Mr Dorsey, 45, will remain on the board until 2022 and but is turning his focus to his other CEO role \u2014 as the head of Square, the payments company he also co-founded that recently was behind the $39 billion takeover bid of buy-now-pay-later platform Afterpay.", "", "
Dorsey, 45, will remain on Twitter's board until 2022 and but is turning his focus to his other CEO role \u2014 as the head of payments platform Square.(Reuters: Charles Platiau)
", "Mr Agrawal earned a bachelor's degree in Computer Science and Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology\u00a0and a PhD in computer science from Stanford University.", "Before joining Twitter, he had worked at Microsoft, Yahoo and US telecoms giant AT&T in various research roles.", "According to American media reports, as Twitter CEO,\u00a0he will receive an annual salary of $US1 million and will also be eligible for an annual performance bonus worth as much as 150 per cent of his salary, meaning he could take home up to another $US2.5 million per year.", "Mr Agrawal has also been granted a stock award worth $US12.5 million, which will vest in 16 equal quarterly increments beginning February 1, 2022.", "Shortly after he was announced as Mr Dorsey's successor, some Twitter users highlighted a 2010 tweet of his, quoting a Daily Show joke about how treating all Muslims as terrorists was akin to treating all white people as racists.", "His appointment as Twitter's CEO comes at a time when the social media giant and several governments around the world, including India's, have been at odds over free speech and fake news on the platform.", "Shortly after the appointment was announced, Mr Agrawal tweeted saying: \"The world is watching us right now, even more than they have before. It's because they care about Twitter and our future, and it's a signal that the work we do here matters.\"", "
Australia lacks diverse CEOs
", "In Australia, it is rare for top publicly listed company CEOs to come from culturally diverse backgrounds.", "Some examples\u00a0include Macquarie Group chief executive\u00a0Shemara Wikramanayake, Stockland's managing director and CEO Tarun Gupta, Orica's managing director and CEO Sanjeev Gandhi, Link Group CEO Vivek Bhatia, Pact's managing director and CEO Sanjay Dayal, Newcrest's managing director and CEO Sandeep Biswas, and Cleanaway, which until January had Vik Bansal as its CEO.\u00a0", "", "
Macquarie Group CEO Shemara Wikramanayake is one of very few culturally diverse leaders of Australian publicly\u00a0listed companies.(AAP: Bianca De Marchi)
", "But as a recent report examining diversity in corporate Australia noted: \"The Australian boardroom is still very much the product of our Anglo and European heritages\".", "The 2021 Board Diversity Index by Watermark Search International and Governance Institute of Australia, looked at 300 organisations and more than 2,000 board seats examining five types of diversity \u2014 gender, cultural background, skills, age, and tenure and independence.", "It found that 90 per cent of directors are still of Anglo-Celtic or European background.", "
Hitting the 'bamboo ceiling'
", "According to Diversity Council of Australia chair Ming Long, the other issue is that when there is a rare culturally diverse appointment, often it's still a man over a woman.", "", "
Diversity Council of Australia chair Ming Long says\u00a0Australia is starting to pay attention to cultural diversity,\u00a0\u00a0but is still far behind the United States.(Supplied.)
", "\"It's still coming out that gender is the most prominent piece of your identity when it comes to decisions of who to appoint as CEO,\" Ms Long\u00a0told ABC News.", "\"That's why role models become really important for other people to come through but also people making decisions about who is appointed to those roles see what's possible.\"", "Ms Long says Australia is starting to pay attention to cultural diversity, but still far behind the United States.", "Ms Long says DCA did research in 2017 that found \"you can't lift cultural diversity programs from the US \u2026. because the heritage is different.\"", "\"In Australia, we're still trying to overcome the heritage of White Australia Policy that's been passed down through organisations and feelings that people from ethnic communities are not seen as leaders.", "\"They graduate through Australia, work in corporate Australia, but then hit a ceiling and cannot get past it.\"", "She says she hopes that more boardrooms in Australia will follow Silicon Valley in recognising Indians and other Asian nations as places to access rich pools of talent.", "Sheba Nandkeolyar, founder of MultiConnexions Group, and past national chair of the Australia India Business Council, says Australia is yet to embrace global trends of taping into global talent.", "\"Australia is yet to discover the talent that's sitting right around their nose,\" she says reflecting on the makeup of corporate Australia, especially in the technology world.", "\"I personally feel that Australia has been far removed as a continent and has very little understanding of the cultures of other countries and the talent that exists in these other countries.\"", "She qualified that statement by then saying many Australian's do not\u00a0know what IIT [Indian Institute of Technology] and IIM [Indian Institute of Management] are, noting that these Indian education institutions have produced a number of CEOs that now head the top American tech companies."]
